COMMENT_TX: $Pedroia homers in his first World Series at bat

$Lowell dove to his left and the ball hit his glove and rolled into foul territory; Taveras ran from 1B to 3B; Schilling and Lugo were late getting to the bag; Lowell's throw glanced off Lugo's glove into the center of the infield
$Julio Lugo ran called for interference for running into his own bunt
$no play for Atkins on the slow roller up the line
$broken bat grounder; the bat barrell went through Fogg's legs
$Ramirez appeared to slide around the diving Torrealba but the catcher grazed Ramirez' hip with the glove; Ramirez only touched the plate after the tag
$Matsuzaka's first major league hit and RBI
$caught at the wall
$Lugo leaped and caught the ball at full extension near the top of his glove
$Hawpe missed on the sliding, backhanded attempt; Ellsbury became the third rookie with a four-hit Series game (Lindstrom in 1924 and Garagiola in 1946)
